
### exercise  {.smaller}


```
int fd = open("output.txt", O_WRONLY|O_CREAT|O_TRUNC, 0666);
write(fd, "A", 1);
dup2(STDOUT_FILENO, 100);
dup2(fd, STDOUT_FILENO);
write(STDOUT_FILENO, "B", 1);
write(fd, "C", 1);
close(fd);
write(STDOUT_FILENO, "D", 1);
write(100, "E", 1);

```
[Assume <code>open()</code> and <code>dup2()</code> <i>do not fail</i>, <code>write()</code> does not fail as long as the fd it writes to is open, fd <code>100</code> was closed and is not what open returns, and <code>STDOUT_FILENO</code> is initially open.]{.my-small} What is written to <code>output.txt</code>? <br> <table>
<tr><td>A.</td><td>ABCDE</td><td>C.</td><td>ABC</td><td>E. something else</td></tr>
<tr><td>B.</td><td>ABCD</td><td>D.</td><td>ACD</td></tr>
</table>
